Well, this is basically Surgeon Simulator, but instead of killing patients, you are killing it making some nice hot tea, sometimes with sugar, sometimes with milk, sometimes with both, sometimes with neither, lol. You lost your arm in battle and so you were given a robotic arm with which you must try to make your aforementioned tea in hopes of calming down after the stress of losing your arm.  Physics based all the way. It's pretty challenging, but the learning curve istn as steep as with Surgeon Simulator.   All in all, it's a charming, sometimes frustrating little game that will make you want to do everything. Took me about an hour to get all the achievements exceppt the play 500 times one, but there are scripts available to handle that one in the comunity hub.  Anyway, pretty fun. I give it 7 broken tea cups out of 10 possible. The spilled milk and hot water abounds.

I honestly have no idea why I play this, I mean it's probably because I'm just trying to get the achievements, or because I'm bored, but when I think about it, the game is really ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Let's start with running the game, first you get greeted with video/graphics settings then when you hit 'play game' or whatever it says, the screen is blank with a white banner for some, but for others, you see language options nd the actual intro which is like 5 seconds and the sounds are loud as ♥♥♥♥. After that, you sit there for like 30 minutes waiting for it to verify that the game is an actual copy, so you can't play offline. After that, the game starts instantly and you are shown a blueprint of the controls, and you notice how limited your movement is (You can only move up and down, or rotate your hand and you can only open and close your hand, but two of the fingers are the same key) and that the controls are real ♥♥♥♥. Once you play, it seems fine until you try and grab a mug where you have two possibilities the entire shelf falls off and you have to reset the game, or if you manage to grab a mug, your fingers will clip right through the handle or stick to you. If you manage to get the mug on the table, you have to put in a teabag and water before anything else, or that will be all you need to do sometimes. Trying to get the teabag in your hand is tough because with your limited movement and bugginess of the game, it will keep slipping through your hands (I once got it in my hands, but the game bugged out and everything on my table either fell off or tipped over) then you have to get your mug under the water dispenser, which has a sign tht prevents you from ever being able to put the mug in the right spot for the water. But, most of the time, your hand just falls right off before anything else

This is like Surgeon Simulator but with a robot hand. And you have to make a cup of tea instead of messing around with people's intestines. Fun, but only for a couple of minutes or so. And, as usual, the controls take some getting used to (some of us might never get the hang of it).  [Rating: 67/100]

This game would be really fun if the clipping worked, but sadly items get stuck in themselves and even on your hand with annoying yet inconsistent regularity. The fingers on the hand will also phase through objects randomly, so you're never able to reliably use them. It's all but impossible to place something in a tea cup if you're unsure whether the laws of physics will work this time around. I'm also frustrated by how random the 'damage' system is. Sometimes you can pick up a cup with no trouble, other times just brushing it lightly will shatter it.   Finally, for an actual design choice, it suffers from a forced perspective, which makes no sense and adds nothing to the challenge save for frustration. If you bump a cup to the wrong angle, it will take you ages to get the handle aligned to something you can pick up and use. That's not fun, and there's no good reason I can't just step slightly to the side so that I can actually line up on the handle. (Edit: There actually is an alternate camera view. It doesn't work most of the time, but if you push the button enough then it will change your perspective. This does not change the angle of the arm though, so it's of limited use. It is handy if you need to see behind something, but it doesn't work 90% of the time when the button is pushed so it's hard to make any real use of it.)  All told, if they ever patch it so that it actually works then I'd recommend it, but as it is there's simply too much randomness to the laws of reality to be fun. If you pretend that you're a poltergeist learning to use its powers though then it does make it a bit more bearable.

A buggy, frustrating and weird version of Surgeon Simulator 2013 where you make tea with a non-functional hand. Just when you think that you've mastered the game you'll run into a bug that ruins your cup of tea. Everything weights the same, so everything flies upon contact. Unconfortable controls makes it impossible to grab things since your hand is so slow that the thing you're trying to grab moves as you're grabbing. You can't play offline, even if you have the game installed on your PC, which is the reason to why we install most games. The help screen keeps popping up when you restart, which is annoying and the game feels unfinished, considering the fact that you can go outside the kitchen, there's no real menu or even credits/ending. On the bright side, it was a funny experience at first and the references are kinda funny since they describe the opposite of what you're actually doing. The concept is also funny (just not done right) and you can tableflip. You also get Steam cards, which you can sell and get the value of the game back. You can also troll your friends by letting them try and laugh as they rage.  Pros:  - Fun first time experience - Funny concept - You can tableflip - Cool references - Steam Cards - Good for trolling friends  Cons: - Disgusting, uncustomisable controls - You can't launch the game without internet - Buggy hand that sometimes has its own will - Everything has the same weight - Slow and weak hand that never grips - Annoying help screen that shows up all the time - Feels unfinished   2/10 - Worth 0.74€ I guess. If you like Surgeon Simulator 2013, Probably Archery etc, you'll like this game the first few minutes and then hate it forever.

The game is based on a neat idea, and goodness gracious I *LOVE* bad puns, but it starts to suck badly pretty quick.  I'm gonna make a wild guess and say the controls are supposed to be wonky to add to the 'humour', but they could really use some polishing. I honestly see no reason for not including elbow controls.  I get that the in-game physics are supposed to be 'funny', but it's just plain annoying that you just need to *touch* the damn shelf to make it fall. Also, camera's weird angles and their very limited number is very, very annoying and really gets in the way of smooth gameplay. It's very hard to deduce the grip angle, and not in a fun and challenging way, but in a tableflipping way.  Music is pretty nice, but could use a bit more variation, and so could the tea 'menu' (ingredients).  The robotic arm breaks WAY too easily.   Conclusion: the game started to cause more frustration than fun very quickly, but if you're an achievement hunter, it's okay. I guess. Still, would not really recommend buying.
